name: Compute
overview:
This class allows you interact with Compute Engine.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: createFirewall
methods.description: Create a firewall.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.protocols
params.description: • A map of protocol to port range. The keys of the object refer to a protocol (e.g. tcp, udp) and the value for the key are the ports/port-ranges that are allowed to make a connection. If a true value, that means all ports on that protocol will be opened. If false, all traffic on that protocol will be blocked.

params.name: config.ranges
params.description: • The IP address blocks that this rule applies to, expressed in CIDR format.

params.name: config.tags
params.description: • Instance tags which this rule applies to.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

exceptions.description: if a config object is not provided.

methods.name: createHealthCheck
methods.description: Create an HTTP or HTTPS health check.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: name
params.description: • Name of the HTTP or HTTPS health check to create.

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • How often (in seconds) to send a health check. The default value is 5 seconds. (Alias for options.checkIntervalSec)

params.name: options.timeout
params.description: • How long (in seconds) to wait before claiming failure. The default value is 5 seconds. It is invalid for this value to be greater than checkIntervalSec. (Alias for options.timeoutSec)

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createNetwork
methods.description: Create a network.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.gateway
params.description: • A gateway address for default routing to other networks. (Alias for config.gatewayIPv4)

params.name: config.range
params.description: • CIDR range of addresses that are legal on this network. (Alias for config.IPv4Range)

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createRule
methods.description: Create a global forwarding rule.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.ip
params.description: • The single IP address this forwarding rule will match against. All traffic that matches the IP address, protocol, and ports of this forwarding rule will be handled by this rule. If specified, the IP address must be a static external IP address. To create a new ephemeral external IP address for the forwarding rule, leave this field empty. (Alias for config.IPAddress)

params.name: config.protocol
params.description: • The type of protocol that this forwarding rule matches. Valid values are AH, ESP, SCTP, TCP, UDP. Default: TCP. (Alias for config.IPProtocol)

params.name: config.range
params.description: • A single port or single contiguous port range, ranging from low to high for which this forwarding rule matches. Packets of the specified protocol sent to these ports will be forwarded on to the appropriate target pool or target instance. If this field is left empty, then the forwarding matches traffic for all ports for the specified protocol. (Alias for config.portRange)

params.name: config.target
params.description: • The full or valid partial URL of the target resource to receive the matched traffic. This target must be a global TargetHttpProxy or TargetHttpsProxy resource.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: firewall
methods.description:
Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine firewall.

See compute/network#firewall to get a Firewall object for a specific network.

examples.code: var firewall = gce.firewall('firewall-name');

methods.name: getAddresses
methods.description: Get a list of addresses. For a detailed description of method's options see API reference.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.filter
params.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this can be a regular expression.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getAddressesStream
methods.description: Get a list of compute/address objects as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See compute#getAddresses for a complete list of options.

methods.name: execAfterOperation_
methods.description: Register a single callback that will wait for an operation to finish before being executed.

returns.description: callback.err - An error returned from the operation.
